result.execSummary:
The defendant Gavin C Farber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gavin C Farber
Current: 2446 Hoard Street, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 1161 Petra Place #4, Madison, WI 53713 United States
Filed By Atty Mark Lawton
Filed By Atty Mark Lawton
Restitution Stipulation filed.

Cases called: 13CM720, 14CF91, 14CF92, Defendant Gavin C Farber in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 2,3,4 in 13CM720 and one count burglary in 14CF91 & 14CF92. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld on burglary counts, 5 yr. probation, $1,750 restitution, pay his portion with first year of probation, $518 costs, submit DNA sample, Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Periodic review in 1 yr., may be done by letter.  No jail credit.   
In 13CM720, Court sentenced defendant to 6 mos. jail on  cts. 2,3,4, concurrent with each other, starting  March 6, 2015 at 6 a.m., may serve sentence in Dane Cty. Jail on Diversion Program, may serve on electronic monitoring. Good time granted. $443 costs on each count.  No jail credit. Ct. 1 dismissed.
Plea hearing on January7 at 11:00 a.m.

Defendant Gavin C Farber in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State objected to motion.  Statements made.  Court will consider modification of bond to allow 6 hours per week with child with mother present, but must have a third party present as well.  Mr. Lawton must make a structure and give copy to ADA Troy Cross to approve of time, and days, of the week.  Then judge will sign and modify bond conditions at that time.  Bond will not be modified until this is done.

Cases heard: 14CF 91 & 14CF92, Defendant, Gavin C Farber, appeared by jail video with Atty Amanda Riek. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,500 recog. bond, in each case, with felony conds. with no contact with T.S., T.O., or the victims. Time limits waived. To track with 13CM720.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 02:50 pm.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
